intro: Pinalia rolfei, commonly known as the Rolf's pincushion, is a unique and rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pinalia rolfei is considered a species of conservation concern.
